title: Shambling horror
data:
- *For the related monsters in [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), see [Horror (dNetHack)](/wiki/Horror_\(dNetHack\) "Horror (dNetHack)").*

| U shambling horror *(No tile)*                                  |            |
| --------------------------------------------------------------- | ---------- |
| **[Difficulty](/wiki/Monster_difficulty "Monster difficulty")** | 15         |
| **Attacks**                                                     | Randomized |
|                                                                 |            |

| U shambling horror *(No tile)*                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |                |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------- |

| **[Speed](/wiki/Speed "Speed")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                               | 12 (random)    |
| **Base [AC](/wiki/Armor_class "Armor class")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                 | 0 (random)     |
| **[Base MR](/wiki/Magic_resistance_\(monster\) "Magic resistance (monster)")**                                                                                                                                                                                 | 0 (random)     |

|                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |                |

| A shambling horror:* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is not a valid [polymorphable](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") form.
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* [never leaves a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless"). |                |

A **shambling horror**, U, is a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") that appears in [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), and [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"). Its various characteristics are randomized in every single game, with the exact characteristics and the ability to discover them depending on the variant.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Create and fill out other variant sections."*

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

  - [1.1 SporkHack](#SporkHack)
  - [1.2 UnNetHack](#UnNetHack)
  - [1.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [1.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)

- [2 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)

- [3 References](#References)

## Description

The stats for the shambling horror displayed on the right are derived from its entry in [monst.c](/wiki/Monst.c "Monst.c"), and act as a placeholder in order to ensure that no serious errors occur should a shambling horror be generated without its traits being shuffled and remapped properly.

Shambling horrors are typically generated as hostile and [never leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death - the rest of their traits vary depending on the variant, including those that are randomized per game. The sections below describe the traits of the shambling horror in each variant, along with a list of its randomized qualities. In all variants, shambling horrors have the potential to range from a minor annoyance to a game-ending threat, requiring extreme caution on the player's part.

A shambling horror typically *cannot* have the following traits:

- [Lycanthrope](/wiki/Lycanthrope "Lycanthrope")
- [Mercenary](/wiki/Mercenary "Mercenary")
- [Phasing](/wiki/Phasing "Phasing")
- [Unsolid](/wiki/Unsolid "Unsolid")

### SporkHack

[SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack") is the first variant to implement shambling horrors.

The following traits are randomized at the start of each game:

- [Alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment") value
- [AC](/wiki/AC "AC")
- Attacks, attack properties and hit dice
- [Monster attributes](/wiki/Monster_attribute "Monster attribute")
- [Monster magic resistance](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance")
- [Nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")
- [Physical size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")
- [Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")
- Sounds made when [chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting")
- [Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")

### UnNetHack

In [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack"), shambling horrors are not randomly generated. They may appear by other means in the main dungeon and [Gehennom](/wiki/Gehennom "Gehennom") and will not appear in [Sheol](/wiki/Sheol "Sheol"), with the exception of [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph") in both cases. Three shambling horrors are generated in [Moloch's Sanctum](/wiki/Moloch%27s_Sanctum "Moloch's Sanctum") at level creation.

The following traits are randomized at the start of each game:

- [Alignment](/wiki/Alignment "Alignment") value
- [AC](/wiki/AC "AC")
- Attacks, attack properties and hit dice
- [Monster attributes](/wiki/Monster_attribute "Monster attribute")
- [Monster magic resistance](/wiki/Monster_magic_resistance "Monster magic resistance")
- [Nutrition](/wiki/Nutrition "Nutrition")
- [Physical size](/wiki/Physical_size "Physical size")
- [Resistances](/wiki/Resistance "Resistance")
- Sounds made when [chatting](/wiki/Chatting "Chatting")
- [Weight](/wiki/Weight "Weight")

Shambling horrors gain the traits of their random monster attributes, e.g. a [demon](/wiki/M2_DEMON "M2 DEMON") shambling horror can be gated by other demons and may be able to gate in demons themselves.

### dNetHack

- *Main article: [Horror (dNetHack)](/wiki/Horror_\(dNetHack\) "Horror (dNetHack)")*

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") and [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack"), shambling horrors are one of three randomized monsters, all grouped under [unknown abominations](/wiki/Unknown_abomination "Unknown abomination") - see their article for more specific information concerning their implementation in those variants.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), shambling horrors cannot be selected as a form for [polymorph](/wiki/Polymorph "Polymorph"), cannot be targeted for [genocide](/wiki/Genocide "Genocide") of any kind, and [never leave a corpse](/wiki/Corpseless "Corpseless") upon death. The following traits are randomized at the start of each game:[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

- Alignment value
- AC
- Attacks, attack properties and hit dice
- Monster magic resistance
- Physical size
- Resistances

## Encyclopedia entry

Despite its eldritch appearance, the shambling horror is  
among the most harmless inhabitants of the Dungeons of  
Doom. Many adventurers who have returned from the depths  
can attest to the varied yet innocuous aspects of this  
creature. It is speculated by some that the shambling  
horror may occasionally possess abilities that are quite  
lethal, but if this is true, no one has yet observed  
them and survived to document it.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [EvilHack 0.8.1 u\_init.c, lines 1260-1370](https://github.com/k21971/EvilHack/blob/0.8.1/src/u_init.c#L1260-L1370)

[![This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.](/images/5/5d/Nh343var-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article describes a 3.4.3-based variant of NetHack. Click here for more information.")

Shambling horror

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
For the related monsters in dNetHack, see Horror (dNetHack).
U shambling horror (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks Randomized
U shambling horror (No tile)
Difficulty 15
Attacks

Randomized

Base level 10/12 (random)
Base experience 202
Speed 12 (random)
Base AC 0 (random)
Base MR 0 (random)
Alignment 0 (random)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable No
Weight 20
Nutritional value 20
Size Tiny (random)
Resistances None (random)
Resistances conveyed None

A shambling horror:

  • does not eat. (*)
  • is not a valid polymorphable form.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • never leaves a corpse.

A shambling horror, U, is a monster that appears in SporkHack, UnNetHack, dNetHack, SpliceHack, EvilHack, notdNetHack, and Hack'EM. Its various characteristics are randomized in every single game, with the exact characteristics and the ability to discover them depending on the variant.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Create and fill out other variant sections."

Contents

  • 1 Description
    • 1.1 SporkHack
    • 1.2 UnNetHack
    • 1.3 dNetHack
    • 1.4 EvilHack
  • 2 Encyclopedia entry
  • 3 References

Description

The stats for the shambling horror displayed on the right are derived from its entry in monst.c, and act as a placeholder in order to ensure that no serious errors occur should a shambling horror be generated without its traits being shuffled and remapped properly.

Shambling horrors are typically generated as hostile and never leave a corpse upon death - the rest of their traits vary depending on the variant, including those that are randomized per game. The sections below describe the traits of the shambling horror in each variant, along with a list of its randomized qualities. In all variants, shambling horrors have the potential to range from a minor annoyance to a game-ending threat, requiring extreme caution on the player's part.

A shambling horror typically cannot have the following traits:

  • Lycanthrope
  • Mercenary
  • Phasing
  • Unsolid

SporkHack

SporkHack is the first variant to implement shambling horrors.

The following traits are randomized at the start of each game:

  • Alignment value
  • AC
  • Attacks, attack properties and hit dice
  • Monster attributes
  • Monster magic resistance
  • Nutrition
  • Physical size
  • Resistances
  • Sounds made when chatting
  • Weight

UnNetHack

In UnNetHack, shambling horrors are not randomly generated. They may appear by other means in the main dungeon and Gehennom and will not appear in Sheol, with the exception of polymorph in both cases. Three shambling horrors are generated in Moloch's Sanctum at level creation.

The following traits are randomized at the start of each game:

  • Alignment value
  • AC
  • Attacks, attack properties and hit dice
  • Monster attributes
  • Monster magic resistance
  • Nutrition
  • Physical size
  • Resistances
  • Sounds made when chatting
  • Weight

Shambling horrors gain the traits of their random monster attributes, e.g. a demon shambling horror can be gated by other demons and may be able to gate in demons themselves.

dNetHack

Main article: Horror (dNetHack)

In dNetHack and notdNetHack, shambling horrors are one of three randomized monsters, all grouped under unknown abominations - see their article for more specific information concerning their implementation in those variants.

EvilHack

In EvilHack, shambling horrors cannot be selected as a form for polymorph, cannot be targeted for genocide of any kind, and never leave a corpse upon death. The following traits are randomized at the start of each game:[1]

  • Alignment value
  • AC
  • Attacks, attack properties and hit dice
  • Monster magic resistance
  • Physical size
  • Resistances

Encyclopedia entry

Despite its eldritch appearance, the shambling horror is
among the most harmless inhabitants of the Dungeons of
Doom. Many adventurers who have returned from the depths
can attest to the varied yet innocuous aspects of this
creature. It is speculated by some that the shambling
horror may occasionally possess abilities that are quite
lethal, but if this is true, no one has yet observed
them and survived to document it.

References

  1. ↑ EvilHack 0.8.1 u_init.c, lines 1260-1370
